result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent J. Byrne

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 002467,
Payable Number: 75686,
Receipt Number: 22R 003904,
Amount: $20.00

10:14 AM Defendant Brent J. Byrne appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Steve Sarbacker appears on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Sarbacker states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  Atty Sarbacker waives time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:40 AM Defendant Brent J. Byrne appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an attorney.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

BY THE COURT:  Set AIA.
bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:11 PM Defendant Brent J. Byrne appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
Defendant has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
